comment: This template demonstrates every single available question type. When a new question type is added, a new version of this template will be made.

template.title: Question type demonstration
template.description: This template demonstrates every single available question type

sections.title: Fill in more than one field
sections.introductory_text: These questions are answered once, but with more than one piece of data. It is quite likely these are poorly supported in other systems.

sections.title: Simple question types
sections.comment: These questions can be answered by a single piece of data of the correct type. They do not support branching.

sections.title: Select one of multiple options
sections.comment: The following questions all revolve around selection one of multiple options. Most of them support branching, which means that if branching is turned on for that question, what the next question is depends on what you just answered.

sections.title: Select more than one
sections.comment: These questions aloows selecting more than one of a set of predefined options.

sections.title: Fill in tabular data
sections.introductory_text: These types are for when there might be more than one row of something, e.g. multiple named urls.

questions.question: Answer with a single line of text
questions.help_text: This type is for a single line of text. Think titles, email subjects, names

questions.question: Answer with some text
questions.help_text: This type is for free text. It'll preserve new lines but does not support any formatting (e.g. bold, italic, color, font, text size). It is good for abstracts and descriptions.

questions.question: Answer with an integer equal to or larger than zero
questions.help_text: This type is for numbers. Counts, sizes, number of days and similar.

questions.question: Answer with any date
questions.help_text: This type is for dates, in the past or in the future.

questions.question: Answer with date and time
questions.help_text: This type is for timestamps.

questions.question: Answer with an email address
questions.help_text: This type is for email addresses. It is validated against a regular expression but it is *not* checked whether the email address is in use.

questions.question: Answer with an url
questions.help_text: This type is for urls. They need to be absolute, that is: start with http or https, and support internationalized urls, that is: characters beyond ASCII.

questions.question: Answer is stored as "Yes" or "No"
questions.help_text: This type is for choosing between two options that can be summed up as "Yes" or "No". It can start a branch. It's for things like "Are there any sensitive data in the dataset", and then questions only relevant to sensitive data could be hidden in a branch that is only accessible if "Yes" is chosen. It could also be used to ask for more information in a branch if "No" is chosen, imagine "Are the data marked up with metadata" and then asking for why not in a follow up question.

questions.question: Answer with one of "Yes", "No" or "Unknown"
questions.help_text: This type is quite similar to the previous type but you have three choices: "Yes", "No" and "Unknown". Each of them can branch off if neccessary.

questions.question: Answer with one of the choices
questions.help_text: This type is for when choosing between "Yes", "No", or "Unknown" is not enough. For instance, selecting between different archiving options. Keep the list of choices short (preferably no more than ten), there's another type for when you have a long list of options.

questions.question: Start writing to drill down through the options
questions.help_text:
This type is for when you have a loong list of potential options, stored only once instead of per question. Branching is not supported since the list is is not unique per question.

This particular question includes the complete list of two-letter country codes as per ISO-3166-1.

questions.question: Start writing to select one or choose "Not listed"
questions.help_text:
This type is for when you have a long list of potential options, but need an out in case there may be additional options not in the list. In addition to the list of options the planner may select "Not listed", which can branch off to a question where additional options can be entered.

This particular question includes the currency codes defined in ISO-4217. At the time of this writing, the Transnistrian ruble lacks such a code so for that one, "Not listed" would be the only correct choice.

questions.question: Fill in an url and a title for that url
questions.help_text: This type is for recording "pretty" urls since they always have a title. On output, there will either be a clickable link that show the title, or both title and url will be shown if clickable links are not supported.

questions.question: Fill in an identifier and the type for that identifier
questions.help_text: This type is necessary to properly support the RDA DMP Common Standard (RDA DCS). What types are possible is defined per question.

questions.question: Fill in a daterange: start date in the first field, end/date in the second
questions.help_text: This type is for date-ranges. Whether the start-date and/or end-date is inclusive or exclusive needs to be mentioned in the help text.

questions.question: Select one or more options
questions.help_text: This type is for when it is okay to select one or more options from a short list, generally no more than ten. Branching is not possible for this type.

questions.question: Start writing to select one or more options
questions.help_text:
This type is for when there are very many options and more than one can be selected. The list of options is stored only once, not per question. Branching is not possible with this type.

This specific question includes all the three-letter language codes as defined in ISO-639-3.

questions.question: Start writing to select one or more options, and/or select "Not listed" if the desired option is not available
questions.help_text:
This type is for when you need to slect more than one from a long list of potential options, but need an out in case there may be additional options not in the list. In addition to the list of options the planner may select "Not listed", which can branch off to a question where additional options can be entered.

This particulr question has a list of taxonomies from the Taxonomy Warehouse.

questions.question: Fill in one or more strings
questions.help_text: This type is for when multiple shorter strings are suitable, for instance multiple names, titles, roles, and each string should be available separately. If they may be munged together, a reason-question is better.

questions.question: Fill in one or more named urls
Fill in a data type, reason for restriction and access url
questions.help_text: This type exists solely for the original branching Horizon 2020 template. It is deprecated and should not be used in new templates.

questions.question: Fill in storage needs: year, terabytes, percentage backup needed
questions.help_text: This type exists solely for Sigma2 Data Management Plan and should not be used in other templates. It is better to create a repeatable section with multiple fields.

questions.question: Fill in an RDA DCS cost object
questions.help_text: This type maps exactly to an RDA DCS "cost" object. There are other ways to achieve this, for instance a repeatable section with the four fields here.
